qas.question: What infamous Doors frontman was once arrested in New Haven?
At what venue was Jim Morrison arrested in New Haven?
What Morrison song pays homage to his New Haven arrest while mentioning the town by name?
What 1991 film depicts the 1979 Morrison arrest in New Haven?
A popular 70s rock band group once played in New Haven, which result in an accident with one of it member, the man name was?
What was the song sung that lead to the arrest of Morrison?
The event in 1967 later lead to inspiration of what movie in 1991?
The movie The Doors however did not film at New Haven, instead where did they film the reenactment?

context: New Haven was the location of one of <a0_0><a4_0>Jim Morrison<a4_0/><a0_0/>'s infamous arrests while he fronted the rock group The Doors. The near-riotous concert and arrest in 1967 at the <a1_0>New Haven Arena<a1_0/> was commemorated by Morrison in the lyrics to <a2_0><a5_0>"Peace Frog"<a5_0/><a2_0/> which include the line "...blood in the streets in the town of New Haven..." This was the first time a rock star had ever been arrested in concert.[citation needed] This event is portrayed in the movie <a3_0><a6_0>The Doors<a6_0/><a3_0/> (1991), starring Val Kilmer as Morrison, with a concert hall in <a7_0>Los Angeles<a7_0/> used to depict the New Haven Arena.
